definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: It is one of the famous paintings in the ancient Eygptian history.
sentences.chinese: 這是古老的埃及史上最著名的油畫之一。

sentences.english: In 1989 he graduated from the Xian Academy of Fine Arts with a degree in oil painting.
sentences.chinese: 1989年畢業於西安美院油畫系，獲得學士學位。

sentences.english: There were no canvases and children adapted to local production.
sentences.chinese: 這沒有油畫布孩子們適應了當地的產品。

sentences.english: She clutched Pat’s painting to her stomach.
sentences.chinese: 她將帕特的油畫捧在肚子上。

sentences.english: Cleaning an oil painting on canvas is a delicate procedure using special solvent.
sentences.chinese: 清潔的布上油畫是一個微妙的過程使用特殊溶劑。

sentences.english: Oils and acrylics can be repaired.
sentences.chinese: 油畫顏料和丙烯酸都可以得到修復。

sentences.english: This oil-painting looks beautiful at a distance .
sentences.chinese: 這幅油畫站稍遠一點看很美。

sentences.english: The Rembrandt's technique in applying light and shadow in painting was unmatched.
sentences.chinese: 林布蘭在油畫上對於光與影的運用是無與倫比的。

sentences.english: In fact, the paintings have been dated back to around 13,000 BC.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，這些油畫大約要追溯到公元前一萬三千年。

sentences.english: Clarify the oil painting art language real meaning and the existence values of the critical appearance.
sentences.chinese: 闡明油畫藝術語言臨界狀態的真正意義和存在價值。

sentences.english: The pianos act as a blank canvas for everyone else's creativity.
sentences.chinese: 這些街頭鋼琴是一塊油畫布，任每個人發揮其創意。

sentences.english: In 2006, liana art space live painting exhibition held in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 2006年在青藤子藝術空間住舉辦秋季油畫聯展。

sentences.english: You can see the evolution process from Frescoes to oil painting in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 在意大利可以看到繪畫從溼壁畫到油畫的發展過程。

sentences.english: Political pop has a new face in Yin Kun' s oils.
sentences.chinese: 政治通俗畫在尹坤的油畫中呈現出新的面貌。

sentences.english: Painting with watercolors is quite different from painting with oils, for example.
sentences.chinese: 舉例來說，水彩畫和油畫有很大不同。

sentences.english: Oil-painting, as a foreign art, has a great influence in China.
sentences.chinese: 油畫作爲一門外來藝術在中國影響巨大。

definition: Republic of China (1912-1949)/used in Taiwan as the name of the calendar era (e.g. 民國六十年|民国六十年 is 1971, the 60th year after 1911)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
